author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: Actor Russell Tovey live tweets from flight to US after man next to him 'stole his blanket' and kind-hearted passengers stepped in with a spare
text:
View
comments
Actor Russell Tovey live tweeted from his flight from the UK to the US after a fellow passenger 'stole his blanket,' 'had a coughing fit,' and 'sneezed seven or eight times.'
The 33-year-old, who is best known for starring roles in the TV drama Being Human, and the film version of The History Boys, was clearly upset by the man's actions, and took to the micro blogging site to share the experience.
And the posts were being keenly followed by other passengers on the plane journey from London to New York, who later posed with Tovey for a photo that was also shared on Twitter.
Tovey's tweets certainly kept his followers entertained as he travelled to the U.S. from London
These two men posed for a photo with Russell Tovey after they offered him their blanket when the actor had his 'stolen' by a fellow passenger
The issue of Tovey's 'stolen' blanket seemed to cause the actor the most angst
Tovey's first tweet on the transatlantic journey described how tweeting midair was 'the future,' as he set out to New York.

British holidaymakers to pay more to visit Majorca, Menorca... However less than a minute later, the Billericay-born Quote: : 'He's also stolen my blanket and sneezed around about 7 or 8 times.. I said 'bless you' first three... I can't be bothered anymore.'
He went on to describe the man's actions as 'kind of embarrassing,' before tweeting that he then had a 'coughing fit,' before putting on an eye mask and 'open mouth snoring.'
Two passengers seated three rows behind the actor were keenly following the action on board (passenger who he Tovey alleges stole the blanket not pictured)
The stealing of the blanket seems to annoy Tovey the most, as Quote: : 'Still asleep with my blanket keeping his feet warm,' and then: 'I'm actually freezing... Gonna ask for another blanket, he's not wearing any shoes.'
But then some kind-hearted passengers, who were also using on on-board Wi-Fi at 30,000ft, tweeted the actor to let him know they 'had a spare one on 7a.'
It was gratefully received by Tovey, who proceeded to pose for a photo with two men and then tweeted his thanks for the blanket.
Tovey was believed to be travelling with the Lufthansa airline, after he included their Twitter handle as the scene played out.
MailOnline Travel has contacted Tovey and his agent for comment, and is awaiting a response.
Tovey is best known for his role on the TV show Being Human as well as starring in The History Boys
The flight began in fairly uneventful fashion as Tovey logged onto the on-board Wi-Fi
